description: From Middle English liknen (“to compare; to be comparable, be equal; to form; to be appropriate”), equivalent to like +‎ -en.

verbs.description: liken (third-person singular simple present likens, present participle likening, simple past and past participle likened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, followed by to or unto) To compare; to state that (something) is like (something else).
examples: The physics teacher likened the effect of mass on space to an indentation in a sheet of rubber.
